com.example.android

Class ImageDownloader

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.android.ImageDownloader

  • public class ImageDownloader
extends java.lang.Object
    This helper class download images from the Internet and binds those with the provided ImageView.

    It requires the INTERNET permission, which should be added to your application's manifest file.

    A local cache of downloaded images is maintained internally to improve performance.

        public ImageDownloader()

    • Method Detail

      • download

        public void download(java.lang.String url,
            ImageView imageView)
        Download the specified image from the Internet and binds it to the provided ImageView. The binding is immediate if the image is found in the cache and will be done asynchronously otherwise. A null bitmap will be associated to the ImageView if an error occurs.
        Parameters:
        url - The URL of the image to download.
        imageView - The ImageView to bind the downloaded image to.

      • downloadBitmap

        public Bitmap downloadBitmap(java.lang.String url)

      • setMode

        public void setMode(ImageDownloader.Mode mode)

      • addBitmapToCache

        public void addBitmapToCache(java.lang.String url,
                    Bitmap bitmap)
        Adds this bitmap to the cache.
        Parameters:
        bitmap - The newly downloaded bitmap.

      • getBitmapFromCache

        public Bitmap getBitmapFromCache(java.lang.String url)
        Parameters:
        url - The URL of the image that will be retrieved from the cache.
        Returns:
        The cached bitmap or null if it was not found.

      • clearCache

        public void clearCache()
        Clears the image cache used internally to improve performance. Note that for memory efficiency reasons, the cache will automatically be cleared after a certain inactivity delay.
